item.title: Curso de Español A1.1 (5/10)
item.description: Vocabulary otra vez = again flauta = flute periódico = newspaper cerveza = beer cereza = cherry Phrase Tocar la guitarra / la flauta Jugar al ajedrez “Jugar” vs. “Tocar” in Spanish Jugar is used when talking about playing a game or a sport. A mi abuelo le encanta jugar al ajedrez. (My grandpa loves playing chess.) Tocar is used when talking about playing an instrument or performing music. Sé tocar la guitarra.

item.title: Curso de Español A1.1 (4/10)
item.description: Words actividades de ocio (leisure activities) deportes (sport) la historia la combida (dinner, food) el arte la música la vida nocturna (nightlife) la literatura el cine la naturaleza los pueblos y las ciudades cosas (f. thing, something, anything, matter, situation) ¿Qué es esa cosa azul por allá? (What is that blue thing over there?) ¿Qué cosas de la lista quieres hacer? (what things in the list you want to do?) escuchar música ir a un concierto ver la televisión ir a una exposición (exhibition/show) salir de noche (to go out at night, hang out) salir de fiesta salir a cenar (go out for dinner) visitar lugares históricos ir al cine cocinar ir de compras (go shopping) ir a la playa (beach) leer jugar a videojuego ir de excursión hacer un curso de teatro aprender idiomas / a bailar hablo poco español (un poco) | poquito So, remember this: poco = amount / pequeño = size/age.

item.title: Curso de Español A1.1 (3/10) | Part 2
item.description: Sentence Tú dónde estás (where are you)? - En la oficina. De dónde eres / es (where are you from)? Cuál es tu (su) nombre (apellido / nombre completo) ? Eres francesa? - Sí, soy de París. Cuántos años tienes? Tienes móvil? En qué trabajas? A qué te dedicas? - Trabajo en un banco / Soy Comercial / Trabajo de camarero. Igualmente (likewise) Te gustan las fiesta cuáles son tus aficiones ¿Qué te gusta hacer?

item.title: You are what you perceive
item.description: 1. Oh, I do believe You are what you perceive What comes is better than what came before Saw Dan Vineberg’s video. And he mentioned these lines when he walked around city of Cartagena. 2. I am not cool and I am not smart And I can’t even parallel park God, it’s brutal out here 3. You know my parents gonna be the death of us all Two TV sets and two Cadillac cars

item.title: Like a Billionaire
item.description: E 84th St, 大冬天, 在Green Kitchen等外卖的Hispanic配送小哥, 打开手机, 坐在台阶上刷TEMU Canal Street街边, 兜售盗版AirPods的小哥 “30刀30刀”, Tourist大妈A “No, I have TEMU”, 大妈大爷Tourist B Tourist C and Tourist D “嘿嘿嘿（银铃般的笑声)” 电视直播SuperBowl, ”本次比赛赞助商TEMU, Shop like a Billionaire“ 家里, 买了100刀PDD, like a Billionaire

item.title: Curso de Español A1.1 (3/10) | Part 1
item.description: tú dónde estás? (where are you) - en la oficina. de dónde eres/es? (where are you from) cómo se dice esto en español? cómo se pronuncia “pizarra”? Cuántos años tienes/tiene? - Tengo 23 años. (The related forms of cuanto change depending on the gender and number of the noun that they count.) ¿Cuánta tarea hay para el lunes? How much homework is there for Monday? ¿Cuánta leche necesito para el pastel?

item.title: Curso de Español A1.1 (2/10)
item.description: Phrases Cómo se escribe “ventana”? Con ‘b’ o con ‘v’? Hablo un poco de español The most natural way to say it would be “Hablo un poco de español”. Notice I left “yo” out, that’s something we tend to do with this type of construct. For example: what do you do at the bar? - “Bebo un tarro de cerveza.” As opposed to: “Yo bebo un tarro de cerveza.” Hablo un poquito de español.

item.title: Curso de Español A1.1 (1/10)
item.description: 1.Phrase Mucho gusto (tambien)! Cómo te llmas? Me llamo djfan. Mi nombre es djfan. Soy djfan. Cómo se llama tu esposa? Hola, Qué tal? (What’s up?) Cómo estás? Buenos días (sunrise - noon) Buenas tardes (noon - sunset) Buenas noches - Buena noche (sunset - sunrise) ¿ Buenas noches o buena noche ? I looked it up and it appears to come from the fact that the Romans divided the night into several watches, 4 I think, hence the plural.

item.title: Back to Hugo in 2024
item.description: 1. Theme Hermit-V2 Hermit-V2 is a minimal and fast theme for Hugo, built for bloggers who want a simple and focused website. This is a maintained fork of Hermit, which iterates over the original work to have a almost-stable experience with bug fixes and new features. run git submodule add -b main https://github.com/1bl4z3r/hermit-V2 themes/hermit-v2 # .gitmodules [submodule "themes/hermit-v2"] path = themes/hermit-v2 url = https://github.com/1bl4z3r/hermit-V2 branch = main Once it’s added, run

item.title: Nomadland
item.description: (2020) Hulu & Searchlight Pictures https://www.imdb.com/title/tt9770150/ https://www.searchlightpictures.com/nomadland/ Director: Chloé Zhao Writers: Jessica Bruder (book), Chloé Zhao (screenplay by) Stars: Frances McDormand Jack Kevorkian Sonnet 18: Shall I compare thee to a summer’s day? (BY WILLIAM SHAKESPEARE) Shall I compare thee to a summer’s day? Thou art more lovely and more temperate: Rough winds do shake the darling buds of May, And summer’s lease hath all too short a date; Sometime too hot the eye of heaven shines, And often is his gold complexion dimm'd; And every fair from fair sometime declines, By chance or nature’s changing course untrimm'd; But thy eternal summer shall not fade, Nor lose possession of that fair thou ow’st; Nor shall death brag thou wander’st in his shade, When in eternal lines to time thou grow’st: So long as men can breathe or eyes can see, So long lives this, and this gives life to thee.

item.title: Embed Spotify Link in Hugo
item.description: In my last post, need to find a quick fix to embed a spotify podcast link to a Hugo markdown file. I found this brilliant solution from Ana Ulin. Here we go!

item.title: Hugo Hermit Migration
item.description: I’ve been using Hugo for a while. Previously, I was using a Hugo theme called personal-web. Recently found a neat and tidy, minimalism template Hermit, which more or less motivates me to be more diligent to write & share stuff, anything, either serious or random topics. side story as a New Year resolution I made N (<3) years ago, I’ve been trying to keep the digital life as simple and organized as possible, which was inspired by this summary by NickTalk.
